title: Andrés F. Ramírez-Mejía (BSc, MSc, PhD)
text:
Hi!
I’m a postdoctoral researcher of CONICET at the Institute of Regional Ecology in Tucumán, Argentina. I was born in Colombia and started my career hoping to become an agronomist, but somehow I ended up as a biologist interested in mammalian ecology. In 2018 I got a Ph.D. fellowship to study crop pollination at Northwestern Argentina; since then, I have been enjoying asado, mate, empanadas and, of course, the 40 °C during Tucumán’s summer.
I created this website to share my work and my general interests outside academic formality.


Current research
I am interested in combining different modeling approaches and field experiments to understand how spatial patterns affect biodiversity and ecosystem services in agricultural landscapes. Currently, I’m mainly involve in two projects : (i) developing a control system for pollination service management in blueberry crops, and (ii) assessing how low opportunity cost areas in large-scale monoculture of citrus can boost taxonomic and functional diversity of pollinators.

Undergraduate
Diversity and activity patterns of birds and terrestrial mammals — During my undergraduate thesis I studied the effect of Eucalyptus grandis reforestation on the abundance and activity patterns of mammals and birds in the central Andes of Colombia. This was my very beginning on science: learning how to ask questions, design field experiments and collecting data, analyzing data, interpreting results, writing and publishing papers. I conducted the project under the supervision of Dr. Francisco Sánchez
This work resulted in the following publications:

title: Blogs
text:
For about ~7 years, I have written thousands of lines of R code for wrangling, exploring, and analyzing data. Some scripts/routins are old and I was still very much to learn, so they probably do things differently (less efficient) than I’d do them now. Still, there is no sense in having them sit in a drawer forever. I use RPubs for sharing and explaining (to others and myself) how to fit statistical models and extract insights from data.
A ** mark denotes that the script is pending to be updated.
